trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: Volo has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Volo has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Kivan to sleep.

trait.name: Archer
entries: A longbow or shortbow deals one extra die of its damage when Volo hits with it (included in his longbow attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Volo makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Long Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volley
entries: Volo can use his action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures with 10 feet of a point he can see within the range of his weapon. He must make a separate attack roll for each target.

fluff.name: Kivan
entries: Kivan is a highly skilled elven ranger, equally proficient in archery and melee combat. In his youth, Kivan was driven to avenge the death of his wife, Deheriana. He channeled that anger by serving the shadow druid Faldorn in various raids against towns and villages on the borders of civilization. But this anger was quelled when he met his future husband, the druid Cernd of the Emerald Enclave. He left Faldorn and joined the Emerald Enclave.

While life was good for many decades, his past eventually caught up with him. Faldorn joined the Emerald Enclave and quickly rose through the ranks to become one of the Enclave's Hierophants. She has been positioning herself to take one of the three spots in the Elder Circle—the three highest members of the Emerald Enclave.

Kivan is torn on what to do. He knows that Faldorn is secretly a shadow druid, but if he were to expose her, she would expose him as well. He would lose everything—the friends he has made, his position in the Enclave, but most of all the love of his husband, Cernd. Cernd has long battled against what he views as the corruption of the shadow druids.
Kivan is a blunt and taciturn elf who values bravery and skill in battle above all other qualities. He tirelessly hones his skills as a tracker and warrior.

entries.name: Kivan as a Contact
entries: Kivan is the primary contact for members of the Emerald Enclave at low levels. Kivan can connect you with an animal or plant companion for a short duration. Your group can only have one of these companions at a time. Once the companion has helped you for a 24-hour period you can make an {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Nature} or {@skill Persuasion} check (depending on the creature) to convince them to stay with you for another 24 hours. Each time you make this check it increases by 1. If the companion dies while helping you, you can never gain the aid of that type of creature again. If the companion leaves your service without dying, then you can ask Kivan for another companion after one month has passed.

entries.caption: Animal and Plant Companions via Kivan

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Nauki is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Nauki has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nauki makes two attacks.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nycaloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. The nycaloth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nycaloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The nycaloth's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nycaloth makes three melee attacks, or it makes one melee attack and teleports before or after the attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns due to a fiendish wound. Each time the nycaloth hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@dice 2d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The nycaloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

variant.name: Yugoloth Summoning
entries: Some yugoloths have an action option that allows them to summon other yugoloths.

entries.name: Summon Yugoloth (1/Day)
entries: The yugoloth chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.
A nycaloth has a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of summoning {@dice 1d4} {@creature mezzoloth||mezzoloths} or one nycaloth.

A summoned yugoloth appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, does as it pleases, and can't summon other yugoloths. The summoned yugoloth remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner takes a bonus action to dismiss it.

fluff.name: Nycaloth

entries: The elite airborne shock troops of the yugoloths, nycaloths look like muscular gargoyles. Powerful bat wings bear them swiftly aloft in battle, and the razorsharp claws of their hands and feet cut through flesh and bone with ease. A nightmarish foe, a nycaloth strikes hard and fast without warning, then teleports away. It uses its innate magic to turn {@condition invisible} or create illusory doubles of itself, further confounding its enemies.
Nycaloths are the most loyal of the yugoloths. When they find an evil master that treats them well, they are unlikely to break their agreement unless the reward for doing so is extreme.

Yugoloths are fickle fiends that inhabit the planes of Acheron, Gehenna, Hades, and Carceri. They act as mercenaries and are notorious for their shifting loyalties. They are the embodiments of avarice. Before serving under anyone's banner, a yugoloth asks the only question on its mind: What's in it for me?

entries.name: Spawn of Gehenna
entries: The first yugoloths were created by a sisterhood of night hags on Gehenna. It is widely believed that Asmodeus, Lord of the Nine Hells, commissioned the work, in the hope of creating an army of fiends that were not bound to the Nine Hells. In the course of making this new army, the hags crafted four magic tomes and recorded the true names of every yugoloth they created, save one, the General of Gehenna. These tomes were called the Books of Keeping. Since knowing a fiend's true name grants power over it, the hags used the books to ensure the yugoloths' loyalty. They also used the books to capture the true names of other fiends that crossed them. It is rumored that the Books of Keeping contain the true names of a few demon lords and archdevils as well.

Petty jealousies and endless bickering caused the sisterhood to dissolve, and in the ensuing power grab, the Books of Keeping were lost or stolen. No longer indentured to anyone, the yugoloths gained independence, and they now offer their services to the highest bidder.

entries.name: Fiendish Mercenaries
entries: Summoned yugoloths demand much for their time and loyalty. Whatever promises a yugoloth makes are quickly broken when a better opportunity presents itself. Unlike demons, yugoloths can be reasoned with, but unlike devils, they are rarely true to their word.

Yugoloths can be found anywhere, but the high cost of maintaining a yugoloth army's loyalty typically exceeds what any warlord on the Material Plane can pay. Being self-serving creatures, yugoloths quarrel among themselves constantly. A yugoloth army is more organized than a ravening horde of demons, but far less orderly and regimented than a legion of devils. Without a powerful leader to keep them in line, yugoloths fight simply to indulge their violent predilections, and only as long as it benefits them to do so.

entries.name: Back to Gehenna
entries: When a yugoloth dies, it dissolves into a pool of ichor and reforms at full strength on the Bleak Eternity of Gehenna. Only on its native plane can a yugoloth be destroyed permanently. A yugoloth knows this and acts accordingly. When summoned to other planes, a yugoloth fights without concern for its own well-being. On Gehenna, it is more apt to retreat or plead for mercy if its demise seems imminent.

When a yugoloth is permanently destroyed, its name vanishes from every Book of Keeping. If a yugoloth is re-created by way of an unholy ritual requiring the expenditure of souls, its name reappears in the books.

entries.name: The Books of Keeping
entries: When all four copies of the Books of Keeping disappeared, Asmodeus and the night hags lost control of their yugoloth creations. Each Book of Keeping still exists, drifting from plane to plane, where the brave and the foolish occasionally stumble upon them. A yugoloth summoned using its true name, as inscribed in the Books of Keeping, is forced to serve its summoner obediently. The yugoloth hates being controlled in this manner and isn't shy about making its displeasure known. Like a petulant child, it will follow its instructions to the letter while looking for opportunities to misinterpret them.

entries.name: The General of Gehenna
entries: Somewhere in the brimstone wastes of Gehenna, there roams an ultroloth so strong that none contests his power: the General of Gehenna. Many yugoloths search for this great general in the hope of serving with him. They believe that service with the General of Gehenna grants power and prestige among lower planar entities.
Whatever the case, no fiend finds the General unless the General desires it. His personal name is unknown, and even the Books of Keeping contain no mention of this powerful, thoroughly evil entity.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Silvyr is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Silvyr instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided Silvyr isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Silvyr makes three melee Shortsword, or he makes three ranged attacks with his daggers.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Throwing Dagger
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Silvyr takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Silvyr halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. Silvyr must be able to see the attacker.

fluff.name: Master Thief
entries: Master thieves are known for perpetrating daring heists. They tend to develop a romanticized reputation. A master thief might "retire" from hands-on work to run a thieves' guild, spearhead some covert enterprise, or enjoy a quiet life of luxury.

When a master thief completes a challenging heist, they often leave behind a calling card to taunt their victims. You may roll on the Master Thief Calling Cards table to determine what a master thief leaves behind.

entries.caption: Master Thief Calling Cards
rows: Figurine made from twigs and twine
Small note with the words "It's been fun!" written on it in an ornate script
Glass bead that looks like an eye
Two playing cards balanced against each other, resembling a tent
Worthless coin with a bite mark in it
Chalk or charcoal sketch of a domino mask

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Leo makes two attacks with his longbow.

action.name: Double sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.
Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The leo has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the leo to sleep.

bonus.name: Doble edge
entries: If Leo attacks with his double sword he can then use his bonus action to make another attack. {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Infernal Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) force damage, and the target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Brass Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Acid
items.entry: The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking an additional 24 ({@damage 7d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Blindness
items.entry: The target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage. In addition, the target and all other creatures within 20 feet of it must each make a successful {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the orthon's next turn.

items.name: Concussion
items.entry: The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 3d12}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Entanglement
items.entry: The target must make a successful {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 hour by strands of sticky webbing. The target can escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity check and succeeding.

items.name: Paralysis
items.entry: The target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) lightning damage and must make a successful {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The {@condition paralyzed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Tracking
items.entry: For the next 24 hours, the orthon knows the direction and distance to the target, as long as it's on the same plane of existence. If the target is on a different plane, the orthon knows which one, but not the exact location there.

bonus.name: Invisibility Field {@recharge 4}
entries: The orthon becomes {@condition invisible}. Any equipment it wears or carries is also {@condition invisible} as long as the equipment is on its person. This invisibility ends immediately after it makes an attack roll or is hit by an attack roll.

reaction.name: Explosive Retribution
entries: In response to dropping to 15 hit points or fewer, the orthon explodes. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must each make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orthon, its infernal dagger, and its brass crossbow are destroyed.

fluff.name: Orthon
entries: When an archduke of the Nine Hells needs a creature tracked, found, and either done away with or captured, the task usually falls to an orthon. These devils are infernal bounty hunters, tireless in their pursuit of their quarry across the multiverse.

Orthons are infamous for their sharp senses. Because an orthon can become invisible at will, its quarry is often unaware of being hunted until the orthon strikes. This invisibility can be disrupted when the devil is attacked, however, so a strong counterattack is often the best defense against it.

Orthons value the challenge of the chase and the thrill of one-on-one combat above all else. An orthon's first loyalty is to its archduke, but one with no immediate assignment might work for anyone who promises it a worthy struggle against a lethal foe. Because they travel widely, orthons are unequaled as guides through the layers of the Nine Hells.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Archmages are powerful (and usually quite old) spellcasters dedicated to the study of the arcane arts. Benevolent ones counsel kings and queens, while evil ones rule as tyrants and pursue lichdom. Those who are neither good nor evil sequester themselves in remote towers to practice their magic without interruption.
An archmage typically has one or more apprentice mages, and an archmage's abode has numerous magical wards and guardians to discourage interlopers.

action.name: Arcane Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The necromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Critical Spellcasting
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on a saving throw against one of the necromancer spells, it automatically fails the save and takes twice the number of damage dice dealt by the spell. Additionally, the necromancer's spell attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Undead Follower
entries: Nina is always accompanied by one of her undead followers, a {@creature gorger}, which takes it's turn immediately after Nina's.

trait.name: Binding Collar
entries: When a special command word is spoken within 60 feet of Nina, the Binding Collar explodes in a burst of energy, killing her instantly. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Charnel Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}15 necrotic damage. The target must then make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the necromancer's next turn.

Necromancers are specialist wizards who study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some like to dig up corpses to create undead slaves. A few use their powers for good, becoming hunters of the undead and risking their lives to save others.

reaction.name: Vile Congregation
entries: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of the necromancer makes an attack roll or saving throw, she can roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the result from its attack roll or saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

Bards are gifted poets, storytellers, and entertainers who travel far and wide, but are commonly found in taverns or in the company of jolly bands of adventurers, rough-and-tumble mercenaries, and wealthy patrons.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (5/Short rest)
entries: Aila chooses one creature she can see within 60 feet and grants them a Bardic Inspiration die, whenever that creature rolls, it can add a {@dice d8} to the result.

reaction.name: Cutting words (5/Short Rest)
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of Aila that she can see makes a roll, Aila can force that creature to subtract a {@dice d8} from the final result.

trait.name: Binding Collar
entries: When a special command word is spoken within 60 feet of Aila, the Binding Collar explodes in a burst of energy, killing her instantly. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the infiltrator is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Papamikosinos is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Papamikosinos instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Binding Collar
entries: When a special command word is spoken within 60 feet of Papamikosinos, the Binding Collar explodes in a burst of energy, killing him instantly. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Papamikosinos makes two Improvised weapon attacks, he can choose to change one or more Improvised weapon attacks for Stunning strikes.

action.name: Improvised weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stunning Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of Papamikosinos next turn.

action.name: Ranged attack
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Drunken blows
entries: Papamikosinos makes two Improvised weapon attacks, benefits from the Disengage action and gains 10 additional feet of movement.

bonus.name: Fight or flight
entries: Papamikosinos takes the Dash or Dodge action.

reaction.name: Redirect Strike
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of Papamikosinos misses him with a melee attack, Papamikosinos can cause that attack to hit one creature of his choice, other than the attacker, within 5 feet of himself.

reaction.name: Missile Catching
entries: When Papamikosinos is  hit by a ranged weapon attack he can as a reaction reduce the damage by an amount equal to {@dice 1d10 + 11}. If Papamikosinos reduces the damage to 0 he can then make a ranged attack.
Infiltrators act as spies, saboteurs, and perpetrators of other clandestine activities. They study magical techniques that enhance their prowess in battle and help them complete their assignments.

entries.name: Monastics of the Cobalt Soul
entries: Scholars, priests, and ascetics who have been drawn to the cause of truth and knowledge spend their lives in support of the Library of the Cobalt Soul, united by the teachings of Ioun the Knowing Mentor. The Cobalt Soul is guided by a central belief that true strength comes from understanding the world around you. Beyond its efforts in knowledge-seeking, each branch of the Cobalt Soul strives to expose lies, unveil propaganda, and fight corruption in whatever society their chapter, referred to as an archive, calls home.

The Library of the Cobalt Soul is headquartered in Rexxentrum, the capital of the Dwendalian Empire on the continent of Wildemount. The organization has archives across Exandria. The Ank'Hareli branch of the Cobalt Soul is based in the Temple of the Mentor. Like many of the archives, the Temple of the Mentor is both a vast library and a shrine to Ioun. This Marquesian archive is led by High Curator Jamil A'alithiya.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Seph is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Seph instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Binding Collar
entries: When a special command word is spoken within 60 feet of Seph, the Binding Collar explodes in a burst of energy, killing him instantly. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Seph makes two Astral self strikes, he can choose to change one or more Astral self strikes for Stunning strikes.

action.name: Astral self strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Stunning Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of Papamikosinos next turn.

action.name: Ranged attack
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Astral self (1/Day)
entries: Every creature within 10 feet of Seph that he can see must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} force damage.

bonus.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: Seph makes two Astral self strikes.

bonus.name: Fight or flight
entries: Seph takes the Dash, Disengage or Dodge action.

reaction.name: Missile Catching
entries: When Seph is  hit by a ranged weapon attack he can as a reaction reduce the damage by an amount equal to {@dice 1d10 + 11}. If Seph reduces the damage to 0 he can then make a ranged attack.
Infiltrators act as spies, saboteurs, and perpetrators of other clandestine activities. They study magical techniques that enhance their prowess in battle and help them complete their assignments.

entries.name: Monastics of the Cobalt Soul
entries: Scholars, priests, and ascetics who have been drawn to the cause of truth and knowledge spend their lives in support of the Library of the Cobalt Soul, united by the teachings of Ioun the Knowing Mentor. The Cobalt Soul is guided by a central belief that true strength comes from understanding the world around you. Beyond its efforts in knowledge-seeking, each branch of the Cobalt Soul strives to expose lies, unveil propaganda, and fight corruption in whatever society their chapter, referred to as an archive, calls home.

The Library of the Cobalt Soul is headquartered in Rexxentrum, the capital of the Dwendalian Empire on the continent of Wildemount. The organization has archives across Exandria. The Ank'Hareli branch of the Cobalt Soul is based in the Temple of the Mentor. Like many of the archives, the Temple of the Mentor is both a vast library and a shrine to Ioun. This Marquesian archive is led by High Curator Jamil A'alithiya.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blackguard makes three attacks, using Glaive, Shortbow, or both.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Aspect (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each enemy within 30 feet of the blackguard must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the blackguard for 1 minute. If a {@condition frightened} target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Lay on Hands (1/Day)
entries: The blackguard touches one creature and either ends any poison affecting it or restores up to 50 of the creature's hit points.

bonus.name: Smite
entries: Immediately after the blackguard hits a target with an attack roll, the blackguard can force that target to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers one of the following effects of the blackguard's choice:

bonus.name: Blind
entries: The target is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. The {@condition blinded} target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Shove
entries: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

fluff.name: Blackguard
entries: Blackguards are paladins who broke their sacred oaths and now indulge their own villainous ambitions. They consort with Fiends and Undead, and they reject many of the goodly things from their former lives.

Blackguards often adorn their armor and weapons with dread accoutrements or are marked by eerie phenomena. You may choose a blackguard's accoutrement or roll on the Blackguard Accoutrements table to determine it.

entries.caption: Blackguard Accoutrements
rows: Armor etched with stylized depictions of gruesome battles
Helm wrought in the shape of a demonic boar
Helm wrought to resemble a death mask
Curls of inky smoke seeping from armor at the joints
Dozens of flies buzzing about the blackguard
Severed hand hanging from a chain around the blackguard's neck
Glaive adorned with a length of cloth bearing the words "I choose violence"

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dreyfus is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Dreyfus has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Unholy Aura
entries: All creatures that Dreyfus chooses within 10 feet of him, including himself, get a +5 to all saving throws.

trait.name: Soul Hunter
entries: Dreyfus is aware of the presence of Tiny or larger creatures within 60 feet of him that aren't constructs or undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dreyfus makes two melee attacks.

action.name: {@item Blackrazor}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: {@item Shrouded Blackrazor}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8+16}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lay on Hands (1/Day)
entries: Dreyfus touches one creature and either ends any poison affecting it or restores up to 80 of the creature's hit points.

fluff.name: Viktor
entries: Viktor was born into a large family of simple farmers harvesting cabbage, beets, and potatoes. His family's farmstead sits on the northern reaches of a village called Barovia. At an early age he learned about the dread master of Barovia ruling from atop Castle Ravenloft. It was his fate and the fate of every other Barovian to never leave the mist shrouded valley. The lord of Ravenloft and first vampire, Strahd Von Zarovich, would never allow that.

But Viktor's fate turned out to be different from the rest of his people. Viktor prayed to the Morninglord every day, promising to serve the Morninglord as a holy warrior against Strahd's evil. In his early 20s, when his family was pressuring him to settle down and marry, Viktor's prayers were finally answered, but not by the god that he had been praying to. Two strangers arrived in the village of Barovia. One, named Borivik, would become Viktor's most beloved friend. The other, Lothar, would introduce Viktor to a goddess who would listen to his pleas—the Raven Queen.

The three managed to escape Barovia with the help of the Raven Queen. They adventured together for many years, forming a strong bond of friendship. The Raven Queen felt her hold over Viktor slipping, as his friends provided him with love and companionship. So, she sent Viktor a gift: a gold dragon named Thraxis that would be his mount and partner. But Thraxis wasn't a normal dragon; he had been corrupted by the Shadowfell.

The whisperings of this new friend began to turn Viktor down a dark path, one that his friends were helpless to prevent. One night he convinced Lothar to return with him to the Shadowfell. Borivik refused to accompany them and so their friendship came to an end.

Viktor is sullen and without humor. His farmer's upbringing means he has no concept of formalities or subtleties. Viktor is distrustful of arcane magic and hates hags, witches, or undead entities that harness magical power.

entries.name: Viktor as a Contact
entries: Viktor becomes a contact for the Raven Circle at 7th level. Viktor can grant memory amulets to members of the Raven Circle in exchange for a devotion token. These amulets are shaped as the face of the person that they came from. When the memory is used, you are transformed into the creature as the {@spell polymorph} spell for 10 rounds. Every round that you stay in the form you must make a successful Wisdom saving throw to avoid being possessed by the memories. The possessing entity will lash out at your friends to try and inflict as much harm as possible in vengeance for utilizing its memories in such a manner. Once the 10 rounds are complete, the possessing entity departs.

bonus.name: Necrotic Shroud (1/Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action Dreyfus can unleash the divine energy within him. The instant he transforms, he gains 16 hit points and other creatures within 10 feet of Dreyfus that can see him must succeed on a Charisma saving throw {@dc 17} or become {@condition frightened} of Dreyfus the end of his next turn. This transformation lasts for 1 minute.
During this effect Dreyfus can once per turn deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to 16.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Val makes two Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

fluff.name: Archer
entries: Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

Some renowned archers and groups of archers are known for the special fletching of their arrows. You may roll on the Archer Fletching table to determine the distinctive fletching used by an individual archer or a group of them.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The val has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the val to sleep.

trait.name: Archer
entries: A longbow or shortbow deals one extra die of its damage when Val hits with it (included in her longbow attack).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Avalon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability  (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks).:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Avalon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Avalon to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Avalon wears a {@item plate armor of fire resistance}, a {@item ring of mind shielding}, a  {@item cloak of protection} and a {@item ring of evasion}. Avalon also wields a  {@item sun blade}.

trait.name: Master Attuner
entries: Avalon can attune to up to five magic items, and he can attune to magic items that normally require attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Avalon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: Avalon's weapon attacks are magical. When Avalon hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The avalon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Avalon makes three Sun blade or Arcane Bolt attacks. Avalon can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: {@item Sun blade}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 7d8 + 7}) radiant damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage if the target is an undead.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage, and Avalon can push the target up to 10 feet away if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Nearly every priestess of {@deity Lolth|Drow|MTF}, including the powerful {@creature drow matron mother|MPMM} in this book, takes an attractive drow as consort. Chosen as much for beauty as for magical might, a drow favored consort can hold their own in both conversation and combat. Combining the roles of advisor, protector, and beloved, some favored consorts are content with a supporting role, while more ambitious consorts aspire to be the power behind the throne—or even to claim the throne themselves.

Those favored consorts who prove their cunning gain the ear, and perhaps even the heart, of their priestess and are relied on to provide useful advice. No position of consort is assured for long, though; Lolth's priestesses are notoriously fickle, and a consort must often contend with rivals.

Some favored consorts work behind the scenes to undermine the evils encouraged by Lolth. Others can be found in Underdark cities free of Lolth's influence, where these powerful spellcasters apply their might toward ending her tyranny.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Avalon makes one Sun blade or Arcane Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Avalon moves up to his speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Avalon uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The royal guard makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The royal guard regains 20 hit points.

fluff.name: Champion

entries: Bountiful and overrated. You can't spit in this realm without hitting one. I have witnessed the birth, death, and unlife of more champions than I dare recount. Few are worth remembering.

Champions are mighty warriors who have honed their fighting skills in wars or gladiatorial pits. To soldiers and other people who fight for a living, champions are as influential as nobles, and their presence is courted as a sign of status among rulers.

A typical champion bears a coat of arms, heraldry that is associated with the champion far and wide. You may create a coat of arms for a champion or roll on the Champion's Coats of Arms table to determine it.

entries.caption: Champion's Coat of Arms
rows: Three lit candles on a purple field
Sea serpent coiled around a trident on a blue field
Hunting horn banded in gold on a gray field
Raised fist grasping an anchor on a quartered field of blue and white
Turtle with crenelated tower on its shell on a white field
Dragon skull supported on either side by dragon wings on a red field
Yellow chicken foot on a black field
Lightning bolt splitting a galley in two on a blue field
Two crouching displacer beasts facing each other on a yellow field
Knotted brambles on a green field
Red owlbear with a silver crown on a checkered field of black and white
Black anvil cracked down the middle on an orange field

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the royal guard fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Malekith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Malekith has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Malekith to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Malekith wears a {@item periapt of proof against poison}, a {@item +2 stormsteel plate armor} and a {@item brooch of shielding} which makes him immune to the damage caused  from the {@spell magic missile} spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Malekith fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Malekith's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the malekith hits with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Malekith makes three Strom's Edge or Lightning Strike attacks and uses Voice of Command if available.

action.name: Storm's Edge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Voice of Commad {@recharge 5}
entries: Malekith orders allies within 60 feet of him that can hear his commands. Each ally can immediately use its reaction to make one melee attack.

Red abishais have no equals among the abishais when it comes to leadership ability and raw power. Red abishais lead other devils into battle or take charge of troublesome cults to ensure that they continue to carry out Tiamat's commands. A red abishai cuts a fearsome figure, and that sight can be inspiring to the abishai's allies, filling them with a fanatical willingness to fight.

entries.name: Abishais
entries: Each abishai was once a mortal who somehow won Tiamat's favor before death and, as a reward, found its soul transformed into a draconic devil to serve at her pleasure in the Nine Hells. Each type of abishai is associated with one of Tiamat's five dragon heads: black, blue, green, red, and white.

Tiamat deploys abishais as her agents, sending them forth to represent her interests in the Hells and across the multiverse. Some have simple tasks, such as delivering a message to cultists. Others have greater responsibilities, such as leading large groups, assassinating targets, and serving in armies. In all cases, abishais are fanatically loyal to Tiamat, ready to lay down their lives if needed.

Abishais stand outside the normal hierarchy of the Nine Hells, having their own chain of command and ultimately answering to Tiamat (and Asmodeus, when he chooses to use them). Other archdevils can command abishais to work for them, but most archdevils do so rarely, since it is never clear whether an abishai follows Tiamat's orders or Asmodeus's. There is inherent risk in countermanding an order given by Tiamat, but interfering with Asmodeus's plans invites certain destruction.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Malekith makes one Storm's Edge or Lightning Strike attak.

legendary.name: Tactical positioning
entries: Malekith moves up to his speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Stormborn (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Malekith releases lightning in a 30-foot radius, blocked only by total cover. All other creatures in that area must each make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Brutal Retaliation.
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, Malekith can make one Storm's Edge attack with advantage against the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lindara's casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lindara fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Blood sense
entries: Lindara knows the exact location of any creature within 120 feet that isn't an undead or a construct, provided that she isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Consume Life
entries: As a bonus action, Lindara can target one creature she can see within 15 feet of her that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, Lindara regains 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lindara makes three Claw Gaunlet or Blood Bolt attacks.

action.name: Claw Gaunlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) magical slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Blood bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) necrotic damage.

Lolth's worshipers expect treachery—the Spider Queen encourages it, after all. A certain amount of backstabbing and double-crossing can be managed, but too much can undermine an entire community. To keep some semblance of order and to root out traitors, priestesses of Lolth employ inquisitors. Inquisitors are chosen from the ranks of the priesthood, and their authority is equaled only by that of the {@creature drow matron mother|MPMM|drow matron mothers} (also in this book) of the noble houses. Anyone they decide is at odds with the hierarchy faces painful interrogation and usually an excruciating death.

reaction.name: Negate Spell (3/Day)
entries: Lindara targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Erestor makes three Greatsword or Poisoned Longbow attacks. He can use Maneuver Allies in place of one of these attacks.

action.name: +3 Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d6 + 13}) slashing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Command
entries: Erestor targets one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. If the target can see and hear Erestor, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this drow that can hear him can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Erestor regains 40 hit points.
Bountiful and overrated. You can't spit in this realm without hitting one. I have witnessed the birth, death, and unlife of more champions than I dare recount. Few are worth remembering.

Champions are mighty warriors who have honed their fighting skills in wars or gladiatorial pits. To soldiers and other people who fight for a living, champions are as influential as nobles, and their presence is courted as a sign of status among rulers.

A typical champion bears a coat of arms, heraldry that is associated with the champion far and wide. You may create a coat of arms for a champion or roll on the Champion's Coats of Arms table to determine it.

entries.caption: Champion's Coat of Arms
rows: Three lit candles on a purple field
Sea serpent coiled around a trident on a blue field
Hunting horn banded in gold on a gray field
Raised fist grasping an anchor on a quartered field of blue and white
Turtle with crenelated tower on its shell on a white field
Dragon skull supported on either side by dragon wings on a red field
Yellow chicken foot on a black field
Lightning bolt splitting a galley in two on a blue field
Two crouching displacer beasts facing each other on a yellow field
Knotted brambles on a green field
Red owlbear with a silver crown on a checkered field of black and white
Black anvil cracked down the middle on an orange field

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Erestor fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Erestor has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the erestor to sleep.

trait.name: Aura of Command
entries: Erestor radiates a commanding presence in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on himself. Any allies in the area that can see or hear Erestor can't be {@condition frightened}.

reaction.name: Protective Shield (3/Day)
entries: When Erestor or a creature within 5 feet of him is hit by an attack roll, Erestor gives the target a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of his next turn, which can cause the triggering attack roll to miss.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kogmus's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}). Kogmus can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Kogmus that starts its turn within 20 feet of him must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw, unless Kogmus is {@condition incapacitated}. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Kogmus's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Kogmus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Kogmus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Kogmus's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Kogmus regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If Kogmus takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of Kogmus's next turn. Kogmus dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Hellish Commander (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Kogmus would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 300 hit points and he regains all uses of Legendary Resistance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kogmus makes three attacks: two with his mace and one with his tail or attacks twice with his Slaying Longbow.

action.name: Mace of the Infernal Comander
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that is not being held or worn, it catches fire.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slaying Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) piercing damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or die.

action.name: Teleport
entries: Kogmus teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Fireball
entries: Kogmus casts {@spell fireball}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Kogmus uses Teleport.

From his bastion, Zariel's second-in-command and the former lord of Avernus oversees the forges that furnish weapons and armor for the Blood War. Though Asmodeus has instructed Zariel to accept Bel as her advisor, Bel and Zariel loathe each other and invent distractions to keep them apart.

Bel outwardly plays the role of Zariel's loyal vassal. However, Bel rankles at Zariel's rulership of the layer of the Nine Hells that was once his, but he won't challenge her directly as long as he thinks Asmodeus supports Zariel.

reaction.name: Tactical Edge
entries: Kogmus rolls a {@dice d12} and adds the result to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. Kogmus can then make a melee attack as a part of the reaction.

monster.name: Dreyfus Death Knight

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death knight is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and allied creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have +5 to all saving throws.

trait.name: Soul Hunter
entries: The death knight is aware of the presence of Tiny or larger creatures within 60 feet of him that aren't constructs or undead.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the death knight fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes three Blackrazor attacks.

action.name: Blackrazor
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shrouded Blackrazor
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 33 ({@damage 4d8 + 19}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Cleansing Touch
entries: The death knight can end one spell on itself or on one willing creature that it touches.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

When a paladin that falls from grace dies without seeking atonement, dark powers can transform the once-mortal knight into a hateful undead creature. A death knight is a skeletal warrior clad in fearsome plate armor. Beneath its helmet, one can see the knight's skull with malevolent pinpoints of light burning in its eye sockets.

entries.name: Eldritch Power
entries: The death knight retains the ability to cast divine spells. However, no death knight can use its magic to heal. A death knight also attracts and commands lesser undead, although death knights that serve powerful fiends might have fiendish followers instead. Death knights often use warhorse skeletons and nightmares as mounts.

entries.name: Immortal Until Redeemed
entries: A death knight can arise anew even after it has been destroyed. Only when it atones for a life of wickedness or finds redemption can it finally escape its undead purgatory and truly perish.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A death knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Lord Soth
entries: Lord Soth began his fall from grace with an act of heroism, saving an elf named Isolde from an ogre. Soth and Isolde fell in love, but Soth was already married. He had a servant dispose of his wife and was charged with murder, but fled with Isolde. When his castle fell under siege, he prayed for guidance and was told that he must atone for his misdeeds by completing a quest, but growing fears about Isolde's fidelity caused him to abandon his quest. Because his mission was not accomplished, a great cataclysm swept the land. When Isolde gave birth to a son, Soth refused to believe that the child was his and slew them both. All were incinerated in a fire that swept through the castle, yet Soth would find no rest in death, becoming a death knight.

bonus.name: Necrotic Shroud (1/Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action the death knight can unleash the divine energy within itself. The instant it transforms, it gains 19 hit points and other creatures within 30 feet of the death knight that can see it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw {@dc 20} or become {@condition frightened} of it the end of its next turn. This transformation lasts for 1 minute.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The death knight makes a Blackrazor attack, or a Shrouded Blackrazor attack if its Necrotic Shroud is active.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The death knight moves up to its speed without provoking  {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The death knight uses Spellcasting.

legendaryHeader: The death knight can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The death knight regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nikholas makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d12 + 8}) slashing damage.  A creature hit by the attack is moved 5 feet in any direction that Nikholas chooses, a creature that is Huge or larger has to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw to avoid this effect.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Nikholas hits with it. If Nikholas scores a critical hit he rolls an additional damage die.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (1/Long Rest)
entries: If Nikholas is reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, he is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, Nikholas can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Resolute Stance
entries: At the start of its turn, Nikholas can assume a defensive stance, attack rolls against him have disadvantage until the start of its next turn and he can't be {@condition grappled}, but he has disadvantage on weapon attacks.

trait.name: Binding Collar
entries: When a special command word is spoken within 60 feet of Nikholas, the Binding Collar explodes in a burst of energy, killing him instantly. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Rage (4/Long Rest)
entries: Nikholas enters a rage that lasts until he falls {@condition unconscious} or chooses to end it (no action required). While raging, Nikholas gains the following benefits:

items: He has {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|advantage} on Strength checks and Strength {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1}.
He deals an extra 2 damage when he hits a target with a melee weapon attack (included in attacks)

entries: When Nikholas's rage ends, he gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Magalan is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). Magalan has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Magalan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Magalan is killed he gains a new body in 24 hours, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears on the altar of the temple of Sagrax inside the Tower of Doom in Niflheim. This ability ceases to function if a cleric of good alignment casts the spell hallow on the altar in the temple of Sagrax or the altar is destroyed.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Magalan has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the Magalan to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Magalan can cast a spell and make two attacks with his long sword.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be cursed by Sagrax. The cursed target can't regain hit points. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

action.name: Assassin's Strike (1/Turn)
entries: Magalan makes an attack with his long sword. If he hits the target and has advantage on the attack roll, then he deals an additional 21 ({@damage 6d6}) slashing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Magalan makes one attack with his long sword.

legendary.name: Cast Cantrip
entries: Magalan casts a cantrip from his spell list.

legendary.name: Channel Sagrax's Hate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Magalan unleashes
Sagrax's power. Creatures within 30 feet of Magalan, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of Magalan's next turn.

fluff.name: Sarevok
entries: Sarevok Anchev is a powerful Deathbringer, an elite group of warriors trained to kill their enemies with a single, seemingly random strike in combat. He is also one of the Bhaalspawn, the mortal offspring of the dead god Bhaal. Sarevok attempted to reclaim the divine seat of the Lord of Murder vacated by his immortal father's demise, but his plans were thwarted when he was slain by his half-brother, Abdel Adrian, who rejected his heritage and fought against his Bhaalspawn siblings.

Sarevok's spirit was sent to the Abyss as punishment. There he eventually crossed paths with Abdel a second time when his noble-hearted brother ventured into the lower realms on a dangerous quest to stop another Bhaalspawn named Melissan. Sarevok agreed to help Abdel kill Melissan, on the condition that Abdel helped him escape the eternal torments of the Abyss.

Abdel agreed, and Sarevok was reborn into the mortal world. After his rebirth, Sarevok was true to his word, and the two brothers fought side-by-side against their half-sister. Ultimately Melissan was defeated, and Sarevok was granted a second chance at life.

With his prodigious strength, his legendary skill in battle, and the Sword of Chaos—a life-stealing, enchanted blade—Sarevok became one of the most famous mercenaries in Faerûn. Yet his many accomplishments brought him no joy. He felt no thrill at victory in battle, no delight in the routing of his enemies. The power he accumulated was bitter as ashes on his tongue, and he became a man haunted by his former life. The realization that no earthly achievements could ever compare to what he once almost had—immortality and godhood—left him broken and empty.

Sarevok plunged into a deep despair. To numb his pain, he indulged in every vice imaginable, squandering his wealth and health on alcohol and drugs. While his divine heritage slowed his aging, it did not stop it entirely, and after decades of self-abuse he was eventually reduced to an old man begging in the streets of Baldur's Gate.

This was how his father—Bhaal, the reborn god of murder—found him. But even though it was dimmed, Bhaal recognized his own divine spark in the pathetic old man, and he sensed Sarevok still had potential. Bhaal recruited him to become the high priest of his fledgling clergy, giving Sarevok new purpose... and another chance to become an agent of death and destruction.

bonus.name: Word of Disposal
entries: Magalan speaks the command word of a Binding Collar within 60 feet of him activating it.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Apollyon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}):
will: {@spell alter self} (can become Medium when changing her appearance)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Apollyon fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Apollyon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Apollyon knows if she hears a lie.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Apollyon makes three Wrath of the Fallen attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of her Chain of Entanglement.

action.name: Wrath of the Fallen
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage.

action.name: {@item Rope of Entanglement||Chain of Entanglement}
entries: Apollyon tries to entangle a creature within 20 ft. using her rope of entanglement, that creature must succeed a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} and take ({@dice 4d8}) piercing damage on a failure. The target can use an action to make a {@dc 23} Strength or Dexterity saving check (target's choice). On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the rope, taking ({@dice 4d8}) piercing damage on a failure.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
entries: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 ({@dice 8d8 + 4}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Teleport
entries: Apollyon teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary.name: Fiendish Magic
entries: Apollyon uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

legendary.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Apollyon emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blinding Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Apollyon targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.
That which falls from grace may yet rise to regain it. If Zariel were to return to her celestial self, how glorious would be the tales!

Once a mighty angel charged with watching the tides of the Blood War, Zariel succumbed to the corrupting influence of the Nine Hells and fell from grace. Asmodeus admired Zariel's passion for war and offered her rulership of Avernus. She accepted his offer, and he transformed her into an archdevil.

Zariel's rise in status came at the expense of Bel, her pit fiend predecessor. Zariel and Bel hate each other. To keep Bel busy and out of her sight, Zariel tasks him with forging weapons, armor, and grue some demon-slaying machines.

To replenish her legions, Zariel needs the souls of mortals to create lemures, which she can then promote to higher forms of devils. She is keenly interested in collecting souls from the greatest warriors on the Material Plane. She bargains hard, and there is little hope of wriggling out of a pact. However, she expects the best from her servants, so she allows her mortal followers to live out their lives provided they continue to hone their talents to increase their value. As a result, Zariel's servants are universally effective, disciplined, and dangerous.

entries.name: Cultists of Zariel
entries: {@note See the {@cult Cult of Zariel|MPMM} entry.}

entries.name: Zariel's Lair
entries: Zariel makes her lair in a basalt citadel that rises up in Avernus. From nearly a mile away, one can hear the screams and moans coming from the burned victims chained to the stronghold's wall, the dying remains of those who failed to impress the archdevil. The stronghold, covering five square miles, is surrounded by walls reinforced with high turrets. Devils of all kinds crawl over the structure, ensuring that no intruders breach their defenses.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zariel can take one of the following lair actions; she can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Fireball
entries: Zariel casts the {@spell fireball} spell.

items.name: Infernal Illusions
entries: Zariel casts the {@spell major image} spell four times, targeting different areas with it. Zariel prefers to create images of intruders' loved ones being burned alive. Zariel doesn't need to concentrate on the spells, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round. Each creature that can see these illusions must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the illusion for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing Zariel's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items.name: Hellscape
entries: The area within 9 miles of the lair is filled with screaming voices and the stench of burning meat.

items.name: Pyres
entries: Once every 60 feet within 1 mile of the lair, 10-foot-high gouts of flame rise from the ground. Any creature or object that touches the flame takes 7 ({@damage 2d6} fire damage, though it can take this damage no more than once per round.

items.name: Smoke
entries: The area within 2 miles of the lair, but no closer than 500 feet, is filled with smoke, which causes the area to be heavily obscured. The smoke can't be cleared away.
If Zariel dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

monster.name: Zombie Morgrym
languages: understands common and dwarvish but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Thunder Gaunlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) tunder damage.

From somewhere in the darkness, a gurgling moan is heard. A form lurches into view, dragging one foot as it raises bloated arms and broken hands. The zombie advances, driven to kill anyone too slow to escape its grasp.

entries.name: Dark Servants
entries: Sinister necromantic magic infuses the remains of the dead, causing them to rise as zombies that do their creator's bidding without fear or hesitation. They move with a jerky, uneven gait, clad in the moldering apparel they wore when put to rest, and carrying the stench of decay.

Most zombies are made from humanoid remains, though the flesh and bones of any formerly living creature can be imbued with a semblance of life. Necromantic magic, usually from spells, animates a zombie. Some zombies rise spontaneously when dark magic saturates an area. Once turned into a zombie, a creature can't be restored to life except by powerful magic, such as a {@spell resurrection} spell.

A zombie retains no vestiges of its former self, its mind devoid of thought and imagination. A zombie left without orders simply stands in place and rots unless something comes along that it can kill. The magic animating a zombie imbues it with evil, so left without purpose, it attacks any living creature it encounters.

entries.name: Hideous Forms
entries: Zombies appear as they did in life, showing the wounds that killed them. However, the magic that creates these vile creatures often takes time to run its course. Dead warriors might rise from a battlefield, eviscerated and bloated after days in the sun. The muddy cadaver of a peasant could claw its way from the ground, riddled with maggots and worms. A zombie might wash ashore or rise from a marsh, swollen and reeking after weeks in the water.

entries.name: Mindless Soldiers
entries: Zombies take the most direct route to any foe, unable to comprehend obstacles, tactics, or dangerous terrain. A zombie might stumble into a fast-flowing river to reach foes on a far shore, clawing at the surface as it is battered against rocks and destroyed. To reach a foe below it, a zombie might step out of an open window. Zombies stumble through roaring infernos, into pools of acid, and across fields littered with caltrops without hesitation.

A zombie can follow simple orders and distinguish friends from foes, but its ability to reason is limited to shambling in whatever direction it is pointed, pummeling any enemy in its path. A zombie armed with a weapon uses it, but the zombie won't retrieve a dropped weapon or other tool until told to do so.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Archmages are powerful (and usually quite old) spellcasters dedicated to the study of the arcane arts. Benevolent ones counsel kings and queens, while evil ones rule as tyrants and pursue lichdom. Those who are neither good nor evil sequester themselves in remote towers to practice their magic without interruption.
An archmage typically has one or more apprentice mages, and an archmage's abode has numerous magical wards and guardians to discourage interlopers.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes three Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Elegant Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Archer's Eye (3/Day)
entries: Immediately after making an attack roll or a damage roll with a ranged weapon, Lord Colton can roll a {@dice d10} and add the number rolled to the total.

fluff.name: Archer
entries: Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

Some renowned archers and groups of archers are known for the special fletching of their arrows. You may roll on the Archer Fletching table to determine the distinctive fletching used by an individual archer or a group of them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

trait.name: Hurl through Hell (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Father hits a creature with an attack, he can cause it to instantly travel through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape. At the end of your the Father's next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes {@damage 10d10} psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. When The Father hits a creature with an attack

Warlocks of the fiend gain their powers through magical pacts forged with archfiends of the Lower Planes. These warlocks often keep imps or quasits as companions, and they tend toward extremes of behavior: consorting with fiend-worshiping cultists or dedicating their lives to destroying fiendish cults.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tanithil makes three attacks. When making a Longbow attack, Tanithil can choose to use one of his arcane shots instead, Tanithil can use this feature 3 per Short or Long Rest.

action.name: Sylvan Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
