entries: Tanithil regains 20 hit points.

bonus.name: Curving Shot
entries: When Tanithil misses a shot with his longbow he can then choose to target another creture within 60 feet of the original target.
Bountiful and overrated. You can't spit in this realm without hitting one. I have witnessed the birth, death, and unlife of more champions than I dare recount. Few are worth remembering.

Champions are mighty warriors who have honed their fighting skills in wars or gladiatorial pits. To soldiers and other people who fight for a living, champions are as influential as nobles, and their presence is courted as a sign of status among rulers.

A typical champion bears a coat of arms, heraldry that is associated with the champion far and wide. You may create a coat of arms for a champion or roll on the Champion's Coats of Arms table to determine it.

entries.caption: Champion's Coat of Arms
rows: Three lit candles on a purple field
Sea serpent coiled around a trident on a blue field
Hunting horn banded in gold on a gray field
Raised fist grasping an anchor on a quartered field of blue and white
Turtle with crenelated tower on its shell on a white field
Dragon skull supported on either side by dragon wings on a red field
Yellow chicken foot on a black field
Lightning bolt splitting a galley in two on a blue field
Two crouching displacer beasts facing each other on a yellow field
Knotted brambles on a green field
Red owlbear with a silver crown on a checkered field of black and white
Black anvil cracked down the middle on an orange field

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Tanithil fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Tanithil's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Tanithil has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Tanithil to sleep.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, when the arcane archer hits a target with a ranged weapon attack, it can choose one from the following three effects:

items: {@bold Bursting Arrow:} The target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage each.

{@bold Banishing Arrow:} The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of it's next turn.

{@bold Shadow Arrow:} If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of the arcane archer's next turn.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Succubi and incubi inhabit all of the Lower Planes, and the lascivious dark-winged fiends can be found in service to devils, demons, night hags, rakshasas, and yugoloths. Asmodeus, ruler of the Nine Hells, uses these fiends to tempt mortals to perform evil acts. The demon lord Graz'zt keeps succubi and incubi as advisers and consorts.

Though legend speaks of them separately, any succubus can become an incubus, and vice versa. Most of these fiends do have a preference for one form or the other. Mortals only rarely see a succubus or incubus in its true form, however, for the fiend typically begins its corruption in veiled, insidious ways.

entries.name: Beautiful Corrupters
entries: A succubus or incubus first appears in ethereal form, passing through walls like a ghost to lurk next to a mortal's bedside and whisper forbidden pleasures. Sleeping victims are tempted to give in to their darkest desires, indulge in taboos, and feed forbidden appetites. As the fiend fills the victim's dreams with debauched images, the victim becomes more susceptible to temptation in everyday life.

Inevitably, the fiend enters the mortal realm in tempting form to directly influence a creature's actions. Appearing in the guise of a humanoid who has previously appeared only in the victim's dreams, the succubus or incubus seduces or befriends its victim, indulging all its desires so that it performs evil acts of its own free will.

A mortal bequeaths its soul to the fiend not by formal pledge or contract. Instead, when a succubus or incubus has corrupted a creature completely-some say by causing the victim to commit the three betrayals of thought, word, and deed-the victim's soul belongs to the fiend. The more virtuous the fiend's prey, the longer the corruption takes, but the more rewarding the downfall. After successfully corrupting a victim, the succubus or incubus kills it, and the tainted soul descends into the Lower Planes.

The succubus or incubus resorts to charming a victim magically only when necessary, usually as a form of self-defense. A {@condition charmed} creature isn't responsible for its actions, so forcing it to behave against its will won't bring the fiend closer to the ultimate prize: the victim's soul.

entries.name: Deadly Kiss
entries: The kiss of a succubus or incubus is an echo of the emptiness that is the fiend's longing for a corrupted soul. Likewise, the recipient of the fiend's kiss gains no satisfaction from it, experiencing only pain and the profound emptiness that the fiend imparts. The kiss is nothing short of an attack, usually delivered as a final farewell before the fiend escapes.

entries.name: Fiendish Offspring
entries: Succubi and incubi can reproduce with one another to spawn more of their kind. Less commonly, a succubus or incubus reproduces with a humanoid. From this unholy union, a {@creature cambion} child is conceived. Invariably, the fiendish offspring is as wicked as its fiendish parent.

monster.name: Shegovax

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Shegovax is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 26}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). Shegovax has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Staff of Power
headerEntries: The Staff of Power has 20 charges, Shegovax can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using his spell save DC and spell attack bonus:

spellcasting.name: Corrupted Orb
headerEntries: The Corrupted Orb has 50 charges, Shegovax can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, spell save  {@dc 20}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks. Each time Shegovax cast a spell using the orb, he must succed on a Charisma saving throw equal to 13 + the number of charges of the spell he is trying to cast or suffer 1 point of {@condition exhaustion}. If the spell normally requires concentration, it lasts for the full duration instead.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Shegovax fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Flames of Hell
entries: Shegovax is covered in dark flames. At the start of his turn, any creature within 5 feet of him takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, if Shegovax desires it.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Shegovax regains 50 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Shegovax dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Infernal Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Shegovax would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 720 hit points, he recharges his Arcane Blast, and he regains 3 uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, Shegovax can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour and his size changes to gargantuan.

trait.name: Aura of Death
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Corrupted Orb must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to the aura of death for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Shegovax uses his Staff of Power ability (if available) and then makes two attacks with his hellfire rapier.

action.name: Hellfire Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Arcane Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@item Staff of Power|| +3 Staff of Power} fires a bolt of arcane magic to a point up to 60 feet away, the bolt erupts in a 5-foot radius around where it strikes. Any targets in the area of effect must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity check or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage. The damage is halved on a successful saving throw.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Shegovax casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Melee Attack
entries: Shegovax makes one melee attack with his hellfire rapier.

legendary.name: Staff of Power (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Shegovax uses his {@item Staff of Power|| +3 Staff of Power} to cast a spell from the staff.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Shegovax uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Corrupted Orb (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: Shegovax uses the {@item Corrupted Orb}.

Acererak is an archlich who travels between worlds and is known to take sick pleasure in devouring the souls of adventurers, whom he lures into trap-ridden dungeons where they suffer horrible deaths. One such dungeon lies under the lost city of Omu. This dungeon is called the Tomb of the Nine Gods, for Acererak slew nine false gods and sealed them within it. More recently, he built a necromantic device called the Soulmonger, then hid it in the heart of the tomb.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Why be a god when I can be a creator of gods?"

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I build dungeons to trap and slay powerful adventurers. Their deaths and souls are my nourishment."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I underestimate the resolve of my enemies."

bonus.name: Burn Üru
entries: Shegovax consumes one of his {@item Soul Coin|| soul coins} and gains advantage on the next Charisma saving throw when using the {@item Corrupted Orb}.

mythicHeader: If Shegovax's mythic trait is active, he can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Teleport
entries: Shegovax's body and any equipment he is wearing or carrying turns to ash and he magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see and reforms.

mythic.name: Arcane Blast (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Shegovax instantly recharges and uses Arcane Blast.

mythic.name: Gore (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Shegovax targets one creature that he can see within 10 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) force damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. If the target fails on the saving throw the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Shegovax can't use his {@item Staff of Power|| +3 Staff of Power}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tirella casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: Tirella carries a magic stone she crafted. The stone grants her one of the following benefits while bearing the stone; Tirella chooses the benefit at the end of each long rest:

items.name: Darkvision
items.entry: Tirella  has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Resilience
items.entry: Tirella  has proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: Resistance. Tirella  has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (transmuter's choice whenever choosing this benefit).

items.name: Speed
items.entry: Tirella's walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tirella makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) acid damage.

bonus.name: Transmute {@recharge 4}
entries: Tirella casts {@spell alter self} or changes the benefit of Transmuter's Stone if bearing the stone.
Transmuters are masters at transforming physical forms. They typically view magical transmutation as a path to riches, enlightenment, or apotheosis.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alianore casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alianore makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Force Blast
entries: Each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from Alianore must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from Alianore. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

reaction.name: Arcane Ward {@recharge 4}
entries: When Alianore or a creature she can see within 30 feet of her takes damage, Alianore magically creates a protective barrier around herself or the other creature. The barrier reduces the damage to the protected creature by 26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}), to a minimum of 0, and then vanishes.
Abjurers specialize in creating protective magical wards. Monarchs, nobles, and other wealthy individuals commonly hire abjurers to provide protection.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Alianore carries a {@item Slumbering Scaled Ornamen} so she has advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} or to end those conditions on herself. She also has a {@item Pearl of Power} which she can use as an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot of up to level 3.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fredrick makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

Bandits rove in gangs and are sometimes led by thugs, veterans, or spellcasters. Not all bandits are evil. Oppression, drought, disease, or famine can often drive otherwise honest folk to a life of banditry.

Pirates are bandits of the high seas. They might be freebooters interested only in treasure and murder, or they might be privateers sanctioned by the crown to attack and plunder an enemy nation's vessels.

bonus.name: Shove
entries: Fredrick takes the shove action as a bonus action against a creature if at least one of Fredricks allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

Bandits rove in gangs and are sometimes led by thugs, veterans, or spellcasters. Not all bandits are evil. Oppression, drought, disease, or famine can often drive otherwise honest folk to a life of banditry.

Pirates are bandits of the high seas. They might be freebooters interested only in treasure and murder, or they might be privateers sanctioned by the crown to attack and plunder an enemy nation's vessels.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance

action.name: Frighten (1/day)

action.name: Taunt (2/day)
entries: Each hostile creature within 60 feet of Cestius that can hear or see him must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attacks made against targets other than him until the start of Cestius's next turn. Cestius can then use a bonus action to make an attack.

action.name: Battle Cry {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature of Cestius's choice within 30 feet of her that can hear him, and is not already affected by Battle Cry add {@dice 1d4} to their attack rolls and 4 ({@dice 1d8}) to their damage rolls until the start of Cestius's next turn. Cestius can then use a bonus action to make an attack with disadvantage.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: Cestius can move up to half her speed toward a hostile creature that he can see.

action.name: Tusk's Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.
Thugs are ruthless enforcers skilled at intimidation and violence. They work for money and have few scruples.
Guards include members of a city watch, sentries in a citadel or fortified town, and the bodyguards of merchants and nobles.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: If Quinto is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, he can drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Brute

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The quinto has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the quinto's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Tusk's Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Garrote

Until this grapple ends, the target can't breathe, and Quinto has advantage on attack rolls against it.

trait.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: Whenever Marjani hits a creature with a melee attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|saving throw} or be {@condition frightened} of her until the end of the target's next turn. Marjani and her allies have {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|advantage} on attack rolls against any creature {@condition frightened} in this way. If a creature's {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|saving throw} is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Marjani's Intimidating Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: If Marjani is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, he can drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Marjani hits with it.

trait.name: Tough
entries: Marjani adds her Constitution modifier to her armor class.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Marjani makes three shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|Short or Long Rest})
entries: Marjani regains 12 hit points

trait.name: Tough
entries: Meggen adds his Constitution modifier to his armor class.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: If Meggen is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, he can drop to 1 hit point instead

entries: Meggen has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by him.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Pin opponent

bonus.name: Adrenaline Rush (3/Long Rest)
