spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Empericasts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The Emperor has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The emperor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: {@classFeature Metamagic|Sorcerer||3}
entries: The Emperor can manipulate its spells using metamagic. The number of uses of each metamagic option depend on the metamagic option chosen:

items: {@bold At will:} Careful Spel, Subtle Spell
{@bold 5/Day:} Distant Spell, Extended Spell
{@bold 3/Day:} Quickened Spell, Seeking Spell, Transmuted Spell
{@bold 2/Day:} Heightened Spell, Twinned Spell

trait.name: Family Reunion
entries: The presence of the Hierarch's living phylacteries strengthens it. For each conscious creature within a 10-foot radius of the Hierarch that is one of its phylacteries, the Hierarch gains +1 to its melee and spell attack rolls.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Emperor casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Might of the Bloodline (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Emperor makes one Might of the Bloodline attack.

legendary.name: Reanimate Family (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Emperor uses its Reanimate Family ability.

legendary.name: Blood Sacrifice (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Emperor uses its Blood Sacrifice ability.

legendary.name: Family Influence (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Emperor empowers a member of its family within 30 feet of it. The creature gains a +2 to all its weapon attacks and spell attacks until the end of the creature's next turn.

Liches are the remains of great wizards who embrace undeath as a means of preserving themselves. They further their own power at any cost, having no interest in the affairs of the living except where those affairs interfere with their own. Scheming and insane, they hunger for long-forgotten knowledge and the most terrible secrets. Because the shadow of death doesn't hang over them, they can conceive plans that take years, decades, or centuries to come to fruition.

A lich is a gaunt and skeletal humanoid with withered flesh stretched tight across its bones. Its eyes succumbed to decay long ago, but points of light burn in its empty sockets. It is often garbed in the moldering remains of fine clothing and jewelry worn and dulled by the passage of time.

entries.name: Secrets of Undeath
entries: No wizard takes up the path to lichdom on a whim, and the process of becoming a lich is a well-guarded secret. Wizards that seek lichdom must make bargains with fiends, evil gods, or other foul entities. Many turn to Orcus, Demon Prince of Undeath, whose power has created countless liches. However, those that control the power of lichdom always demand fealty and service for their knowledge.

A lich is created by an arcane ritual that traps the wizard's soul within a phylactery. Doing so binds the soul to the mortal world, preventing it from traveling to the Outer Planes after death. A phylactery is traditionally an amulet in the shape of a small box, but it can take the form of any item possessing an interior space into which arcane sigils of naming, binding, immortality, and dark magic are scribed in silver.

With its phylactery prepared, the future lich drinks a potion of transformation-a vile concoction of poison mixed with the blood of a sentient creature whose soul is sacrificed to the phylactery. The wizard falls dead, then rises as a lich as its soul is drawn into the phylactery, where it forever remains.

entries.name: Soul Sacrifices
entries: A lich must periodically feed souls to its phylactery to sustain the magic preserving its body and consciousness. It does this using the {@spell imprisonment} spell. Instead of choosing one of the normal options of the spell, the lich uses the spell to magically trap the target's body and soul inside its phylactery. The phylactery must be on the same plane as the lich for the spell to work. A lich's phylactery can hold only one creature at a time, and a {@spell dispel magic} cast as a 9th-level spell upon the phylactery releases any creature imprisoned within it. A creature imprisoned in the phylactery for 24 hours is consumed and destroyed utterly, whereupon nothing short of divine intervention can restore it to life.
A lich that fails or forgets to maintain its body with sacrificed souls begins to physically fall apart, and might eventually become a demilich.

entries.name: Death and Restoration
entries: When a lich's body is broken by accident or assault, the will and mind of the lich drains from it, leaving only a lifeless corpse behind. Within days, a new body reforms next to the lich's phylactery, coalescing out of glowing smoke that issues from the device. Because the destruction of its phylactery means the possibility of eternal death, a lich usually keeps its phylactery in a hidden, well-guarded location.

Destroying a lich's phylactery is no easy task and often requires a special ritual, item, or weapon. Every phylactery is unique, and discovering the key to its destruction can be a quest in and of itself.

entries.name: Lonely Existence
entries: From time to time, a lich might be stirred from its single-minded pursuit of power to take an interest in the world around it, most often when some great event reminds it of the life it once led. It otherwise lives in isolation, engaging only with those creatures whose service helps secure its lair.
Few liches call themselves by their former names, instead adopting monikers such as the Black Hand or the Forgotten King.

entries.name: Magic Collectors
entries: Liches collect spells and magic items. In addition to its spell repertoire, a lich has ready access to potions, scrolls, libraries of spellbooks, one or more wands, and perhaps a staff or two. It has no qualms about putting these treasures to use whenever its lair comes under attack.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: A Lich's Lair
entries: A lich often haunts the abode it favored in life, such as a lonely tower, a haunted ruin, or an academy of black magic. Alternatively, some liches construct secret tombs filled with powerful guardians and traps. Everything about a lich's lair reflects its keen mind and wicked cunning, including the magic and mundane traps that secure it. Undead, constructs, and bound demons lurk in shadowy recesses, emerging to destroy those who dare to disturb the lich's work.
A lich encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 22 (41,000 XP).

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lich can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the lich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The lich rolls a {@dice d8} and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If it has no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.

The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the lich to the target. Whenever the lich takes damage, the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the lich takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round or until the lich or the target is no longer in the lich's lair.

The lich calls forth the spirits of creatures that died in its lair. These apparitions materialize and attack one creature that the lich can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The apparitions then disappear.

action.name: Might of the Bloodline
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If either the Emperor or the target is within 10 feet of one of the Emperor's phylacteries, the spell damage increases by {@damage 1d6}.

action.name: Reanimate Family
entries: The Emperor targets the corpse of a creature in his bloodline that has died within the last minute.  The corpse rises immediately after as a {@creature wight} under the Emperor's control.

action.name: Blood Sacrifice
entries: The Emperor targets a creature in his bloodline and drains their energy. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 19}) or take {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage. The Emperor is then healed for an amount of hit points equal to the damage inflicted and regains one use of a spell or a use of metamagic of the Emperor's choice.

legendaryHeader: The Emperor can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The emperor regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

action.name: Tusk's Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6-1}) slashing damage.
Commoners include peasants, serfs, slaves, servants, pilgrims, merchants, artisans, and hermits.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When Kabbarg is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, she can drop to 1 hit point instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Melibea is an 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). Melibea has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Melibea adds +5 to one damage rolls for these spells.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Melibea has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Melibea wears a {@item robe of the archmagi}, and uses a {@item Protective Verses|tce|spellbook of protective verses} and an {@item amulet of health}.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Melibea's darkvision.

trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: When Melibea casts an evocation spell that forces other creatures she can see to make a saving throw, she can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. These creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell and take no damage from it.

trait.name: Potent Cantrips
entries: Whenever a creature succeeds the saving throw to avoid the damage of a cantrip it takes half the damage instead but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

action.name: {@item Bead of Force} (8 beads)
entries: Melibea throws one bead at a point within 60 feet. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d4} force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save, or are partially within the area, are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Overchannel
entries: Melibea can cast a spell of up to 5th-level that deals damage and cause it to deal maximum damage. If she uses this feature again before she finishes a long rest, she takes {@damage 2d12} necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after she casts it. Each time she uses this feature again before finishing a long rest, the necrotic damage per spell level increases by {@damage 1d12}.

items.name: Scorching Ray 5th-level
items.entry: 6 rays that deal 12 fire damage each, for a total of 72 fire damage.

entries: Archmages are powerful (and usually quite old) spellcasters dedicated to the study of the arcane arts. Benevolent ones counsel kings and queens, while evil ones rule as tyrants and pursue lichdom. Those who are neither good nor evil sequester themselves in remote towers to practice their magic without interruption.
An archmage typically has one or more apprentice mages, and an archmage's abode has numerous magical wards and guardians to discourage interlopers.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The executor casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The executor attacks twice with its Psychic Blade or casts Mind sliver twice.

action.name: Psychic Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@dice 1d10 + 4}) if used with two hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Sliver
entries: The executor targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) psychic damage and subtract  {@dice 1d4} from the next saving throw it makes before the end of the executor's next turn.

action.name: Executor's Command {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature of the executor's choice that it can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the start of the executor's next turn. On the {@condition charmed} target's turn, the executor can telepathically control the target's move, action, or both. When controlled in this way, the target can take only the Attack (executor chooses the target) or Dash action.

"Evil lurks everywhere. With our minds, we will unearth it, we will plumb its depths, and we will annihilate it." With those words, the psychically gifted priest Ulmed founded the Ulmist Inquisition, an order of psionic inquisitors that seeks to discover the wickedness hiding in people's souls.

In the days before Count Strahd von Zarovich became the first vampire, Strahd thundered across the lands with Ulmed. Their mission was clear: to destroy the infernal powers that had corrupted the world and to ensure that those powers never rose again. Strahd, Ulmed, and their companions hunted Fiends, Undead, Aberrations, and other supernatural threats and were tireless foes of cults like the priests of Osybus. When Strahd fell into darkness, Ulmed was heartbroken at his friend's transformation and changed the inquisition's mission. Instead of focusing on hunting monsters, it would also hunt the seeds of evil that can corrupt a person.

Ulmed and his friends Cosima, Ansel, and Tristian organized the inquisition into three orders, with each one specializing in a type of psionic power. The Order of Cosima harnessed the Mind Fire—their name for the fire of thought that blazes within each person's mind. They used that power to read thoughts, reshape memories, and dominate the recalcitrant. The inquisitors in the Order of Ansel subjected themselves to harsh asceticism in an effort to use psionic energy to empower their own bodies. They succeeded and became the martial arm of the inquisition, represented by a sword. Finally, the Order of Tristian endeavored to use intellect to alter the environment through telekinetic force, and the order's members became the inquisition's scholars, represented by a tome.

Today the inquisition rules the city of Malitain, a vast city-state to the north of Barovia's original site, and the inquisition sends its members throughout the multiverse, seeking to thwart the work of malevolent cults, otherworldly horrors, and the malice of mortals. The zeal of the inquisitors in this work has caused them to be a source of terror in many communities, where folk fear that an overzealous inquisitor might be as great a monster as the fiends the inquisitors originally hunted.

trait.name: Shielded Mind
entries: The executor is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions, read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying or know his alignment.

bonus.name: Telekinetic Force
entries: The executor can try to telekinetically shove one creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from him. A creature can willingly fail this save.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Emerlyn can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Emerlyn deals an extra 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Emerlyn that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Emerlyn doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Emerlyn has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Emerlyn to sleep.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Rulers, nobles, merchants, guildmasters, and other wealthy individuals use spies to gain the upper hand in a world of cutthroat politics. A spy is trained to secretly gather information. Loyal spies would rather die than divulge information that could compromise them or their employers.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, when the arcane archer hits a target with a ranged weapon attack, it can choose one from the following three effects:

items: {@bold Bursting Arrow:} The target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage each.

{@bold Enfeebling Arrow:} The target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks are halved until the start of the arcane archer's next turn.

{@bold Shadow Arrow:} If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of the arcane archer's next turn.

trait.name: Curving Shot
entries: When the arcane archer makes a ranged attack roll and misses, it can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

trait.name: Magic Ranged Weapons
entries: The arcane archer's ranged weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The Exedilica arcane archer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the exedilica arcane archer to sleep.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darknes, slightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena, the exedilica arcane archer can take the {@action Hide} action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcane archer makes three ranged weapon attacks or two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sylvan Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Spotted Ankheg

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spotted ankheg attacks twice with its Claws and then makes a Bite attack. Alternatively it can make two claw attacks with a 10 feet range.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If both attacks hit the same target, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away of the spotted ankheg and fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can bite only the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge}
entries: The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, provided that it has no creature {@condition grappled}. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

An ankheg resembles an enormous many-legged insect, its long antennae twitching in response to any movement around it. Its legs end in sharp hooks adapted for burrowing and grasping its prey, and its powerful mandibles can snap a small tree in half.

entries.name: Lurkers in the Earth
entries: The ankheg uses its powerful mandibles to dig winding tunnels deep beneath the ground. When it hunts, an ankheg burrows upward, waiting below the surface until its antennae detect movement from above. Then it bursts from the earth and seizes prey in its mandibles, crushing and grinding while it secretes acidic digestive enzymes. These enzymes help dissolve a victim for easy swallowing, but the ankheg can also squirt acid to take down foes.

entries.name: Bane of Field and Forest
entries: Although ankhegs receive a certain portion of their nutrients from the soil through which they burrow, they must supplement their diet with fresh meat. Pastures teeming with grazing livestock and forests rife with game are an ankheg's prime hunting grounds. Ankhegs are thus the bane of farmers and rangers everywhere.

entries.name: Earthen Tunnels
entries: As it burrows through earth, the ankheg leaves a narrow, partially collapsed tunnel in its wake. In these tunnels, one might find the remnants of molted ankheg chitin, hatched ankheg eggs, or the grisly remains of ankheg victims, including coins or other treasures scattered during the creature's attack.

bonus.name: Take remains
entries: The spotted ankheg makes a Claw attack against a creature that is {@condition prone} within 10 feet.

reaction.name: Acid Glob
entries: When a creature tries to get away from the spotted ankheg, it can make an acid glob attack of opportunity. {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 5/10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage. If the attack hits, the target is also considered {@condition grappled} by the glob of acid until the start of it's next turn.

trait.name: Acid for Blood
entries: The first time the spotted ankheg is hit with a melee attack, the creature that hit it takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the spotted ankheg dies, it twists in a burst of acid. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Burrow (Round 1)
entries: The spotted ankheg uses it's burrowing speed to go underground and dig underneath an enemy creature.

legendary.name: Pull Underground (Round 2)
entries: The spotted ankheg digs a 5 feet wide hole under an enemy creature it can sense within 15 feet over itself and that is standing on terrain and pulls the creature to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of itself.

legendary.name: Acid Explosion (Round 3)
entries: The spotted ankheg sprays acid through it's wounds. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: The spotted ankheg takes one Villain Action on each round at the end of another creature's turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The inquisitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Mental Discipline
entries: The inquisitor is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions, read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. The inquisitor has advantage in Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status concentration}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The inquisitor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the inquisitor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inquisitor makes  two Mind Fire attacks or three Psychic Blade attacks. Two of the Psychic Blade attacks can be replaced by a Mind Fire attack or a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Psychic Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Fire
entries: The inquisitor targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the start of the inquisitor's next turn.

action.name: Psychic Blast {@recharge 6}
entries: The inquisitor emits psionic energy in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the inquisitor's next turn. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage. The {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

bonus.name: Telekinetic Force
entries: The inquisitor can try to telekinetically shove one creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from him. A creature can willingly fail this save.

High Master Kansaldi Fire-Eyes leads the Red Dragon Army's offensive in Solamnia. A fanatical adherent of the Dragon Queen, Kansaldi was indoctrinated into the god's worship by Dragon High Lord Verminaard. During a test of faith from her mentor, Kansaldi replaced her left eye with a gem of seeing. This gem smolders and glows red whenever Kansaldi uses her magic, and her followers claim it allows her to see through any lie.

Highlord Verminaard follows visions from the Dragon Queen on a campaign south. In his absence, he left a powerful contingent of the Red Dragon Army under Kansaldi's command and ordered her to claim the Kalaman region in the Dragon Queen's name. Kansaldi pursues these orders with a fanatic's zeal. For her, there is no possibility of defeat—there is only the Dragon Queen's will.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The inquisitor adds 3 to its AC against one attack roll that would hit him. To do so, the inquisitor must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

Tribal warriors live beyond civilization, most often subsisting on fishing and hunting. Each tribe acts in accordance with the wishes of its chief, who is the greatest or oldest warrior of the tribe or a tribe member blessed by the gods.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The wood elf raider has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The wood elf raider has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the wood elf raider to sleep.

trait.name: Aura of Fervor
entries: An ally that is within 30 feet of the hobgoblin and can see and hear the hobgoblin has advantage to saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}, and all attack rolls against enemies within 30 feet of the hobgoblin, provided that the hobgoblin isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The hobgoblin rerolls a failed save. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Martial Advantage (1/Turn)
entries: The hobgoblin can deal an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes three greatsword attacks. It can use Maneuver Allies, Hold the Line, or Unleash Hell in place of one of these attacks, if available.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this hobgoblin that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Hold the Line
entries: (1/Day). The hobgoblin targets each nonhostile creature of its choice that is within 60 feet of it, can hear it, is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated} and not already affected by Hold the Line. Until the end of the hobgoblin's next turn, creatures provoke an {@action opportunity attack} from the target when they move 5 feet or more while within the target's reach, and if the target hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the current turn.

action.name: Unleash Hell
entries: (1/Day). Up to 6 nonhostile creatures of the hobgoblin's choice that is within 60 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Unleash Hell can use their reaction to move up to half their speed and make one weapon attack.

reaction.name: General's Guidance (5/day)
entries: When a creature the hobgoblin can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw, and the creature can hear the hobgoblin, the hobgoblin grants advantage to that roll.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The hobgoblin moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Greatsword (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hobgoblin makes a greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Tactical Edge (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} for the hobgoblin. The number rolled on the die is subtracted from the next attack roll made against the hobgoblin or an ally of its choice within the next minute.

legendary.name: Command Allies (Costs 1-3 Actions)
entries: The hobgoblin chooses up to 3 allies it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the hobgoblin, the target can use its reaction to make one weapon attack. It costs 1 legendary action per target.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 60 ft., one creature.  {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of Galeria's next turn.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.
Evil mages (such as Iarno Albrek and Hamun Kost) hunger for arcane power and dwell in isolated places, where they can perform terrible magical experiments without interference.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Galeria is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16},  {@hit +8} to hit with spell attacks). Galeria has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Attacks (in Fractured Rage Only)
entries: When the fractured noble scores a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, it can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Fractured Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the fractured noble becomes enraged, swelling in size and distorting facial features to an unrecognizable state. This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until the noble is {@condition incapacitated}. While enraged, the noble gains 31 temporary hit points. Also, when the noble makes a Strength check, Strength saving throw, or damage roll with a Strength-based attack, the noble can roll {@dice 2d4} and add the total rolled to the result.

trait.name: Instinctive
entries: The fractured noble has advantage on initiative checks. If {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, unless {@condition incapacitated}, the fractured noble can act normally during its first turn even if {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} but must enter Fractured Rage to start that turn.

trait.name: Reckless (in Fractured Rage Only)
entries: At the start of its turn, the fractured noble can gain advantage on melee weapon attack rolls until the start of its next turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until then.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fractured noble makes two melee attacks. In Fractured Rage, it can make three melee attacks instead.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ferrek makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.
Thugs are ruthless enforcers skilled at intimidation and violence. They work for money and have few scruples.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Ferrek has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vegepygmy regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The vegepygmy casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spore Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of the vegepygmy's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deck wizard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

These salt-encrusted practitioners of magic are at once learned and superstitious. The crews of pirate ships generally give their deck wizards a wide berth, as they magically step from place to place and unleash their briny magic against attackers. The ship Sea Ghost in The Sinister Secret of Saltmarsh is home to a pirate deck wizard named Punketah.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: The pickpocket can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pickpocket makes three dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

By offering a place for those of many different talents, the Cult of Rakdos has seen its numbers swell with performing artists, including blade jugglers, fire eaters, and high wire acrobats. Performers carry the message of Rakdos out into the streets: cut loose, free yourself from the bonds of society's mores and expectations, and indulge your desires.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arcane renegade is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Eternal Flame priests see the world around them as impure and unworthy, and believe that only cleansing by fire can set it right. As a result, all fire is deemed holy, from the smallest candle flame to the greatest conflagrations. When traveling in the open, Eternal Flame priests are clever enough to hide their true beliefs, passing themselves off as druids or wizards with a knack for fire magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Amarillo makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cruel Notes
entries: Amarillo targets a creature within 30 feet that is {@condition charmed} by its luring melody. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on saving throws for 1 minuite. Success results in half as much damage and no disadvantage on saving throws.

action.name: Luring Melody
entries: Amarillo plays a magical melody on her flute. Every living creature within 120 feet of Amarillo who hears the melody must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the melody ends. Amarillo must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue playing. She can stop playing at any time. The song ends if Amarillo is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by Amarillo, a target is {@condition incapacitated}. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from Amarillo, the target must move on its turn toward Amarillo by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than Amarillo, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to Amarillo's music for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Amarillo has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the amarillo to sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Añil casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Añil makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Truthful Words
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm {@recharge 4}
entries: When a visible creature within 30 feet of Añil makes an attack roll against him, Añil forces the attacker to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker redirects the attack roll to the creature closest to it, other than Añil or itself. If multiple eligible creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.
Enchanters know how to magically influence minds. Benign enchanters use this magic to defuse violence and sow peace, while malevolent enchanters are some of the most evil of all spellcasters.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Violeta casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Violeta makes two Shortsword or Shortbow attacks. he can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cacophony {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from Violeta must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from Violeta. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

bonus.name: Taunt (2/Day)
entries: Violeta targets one creature within 30 feet of him. If the target can hear Violeta, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of Violeta's next turn.

fluff.name: Bard
entries: Bards are gifted poets, storytellers, and entertainers who travel far and wide. They're commonly found in taverns or in the company of jolly bands of adventurers, rough-and-tumble mercenaries, and wealthy patrons.
Each bard is a master of at least one type of performance. You may choose a bard's main type, or you may roll on the Bard {@skill Performance} Types table to determine it.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Violeta has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Violeta to sleep.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: Verde jumps up to 50 feet with its movement. As a bonus action, it can jump an additional 50 feet.

trait.name: Thrashing Limbs
entries: Verde has three reactions per round, but she can use only one during any given turn. Any creature that moves into, out of, or within Verde's reach provokes an {@action opportunity attack|PHB} from Verde.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Verde has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Verde has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Verde to sleep.

action.name: Pole
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Artistic Jump
entries: Verde jumps up to 50 feet.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rojo casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Fool's Blessing
entries: Any creature that attempts to damage Rojo must first succeed on a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way must use its action praising Rojo.
Rojo can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through his Reversal of Fortune reaction.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Rojo has advantage on saving throws against poison.

action.name: Fool's Scepter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mocking Word
entries: Rojo targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Rojo takes the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Reversal of Fortune
entries: In response to another creature dealing damage to Rojo, Rojo reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

fluff.name: Nilbog
entries: When Maglubiyet conquered the goblin gods, a trickster deity was determined to get the last laugh. Although Maglubiyet shattered its essence, this trickster god survives in a splintered form as possessing spirits that cause disorder unless they are appeased. Goblins have no name for this deity and dare not give it one, lest Maglubiyet use its name to ensnare and crush it as he did their other deities. They call the possessing spirit, as well as the goblin possessed by it, a nilbog ("goblin" spelled backward), and they revel in the chaos a nilbog sows.

Whenever goblinoids form a host, there is a chance that a goblin will become possessed by a nilbog, particularly if the goblins have been mistreated by their betters. The possessed goblin turns into a wisecracking, impish creature fearless of reprisal. This nilbog also gains strange powers that drive others to do the opposite of what they desire. Attacking the possessed goblin is foolhardy, and killing them just prompts the spirit to possess another goblin. The only way to keep a nilbog from wreaking havoc is to treat it well and give it respect and praise.

Among fey courts, the risk of attracting a nilbog has given rise to the practice of always including at least one goblin jester. This jester is allowed to go anywhere and do whatever they please, hopefully preventing a nilbog from manifesting. The position of jester is much sought-after among the courts' goblins, because even if the jester is obviously not a nilbog, the court must indulge their chaotic behavior.

entries.name: Nilbogism
entries: A nilbog is an invisible spirit that possesses only goblins. When bereft of a host, the spirit has a flying speed of 30 feet, it can't be attacked, and it is immune to all damage and conditions. Acting on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the only action it can take is to attempt to possess a goblin within 5 feet of it.

A goblin targeted by the spirit must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or become possessed. While possessed, the goblin uses the nilbog stat block. If the save succeeds, the spirit can't possess that goblin for 24 hours.

If its host is killed or the possession is ended by a spell such as hallow, magic circle, or protection from evil and good, the spirit searches for another goblin to possess. The spirit can leave its host at any time, but it won't do so willingly unless it knows there's another potential host nearby. A goblin stripped of their nilbog spirit reverts to their normal statistics and loses the traits they gained while possessed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rodgur is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). He has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: On each of its turns, Rodgur can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: Rodgur deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with his weapon attack if he hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points. If the creature's hit points drop to 0, Rodgur can choose to knock the creature {@condition unconscious} instead of leaving it dying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rodgur makes two melee attacks or one ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Arbalest
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Señor croma casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Señor Croma makes two Radiant Strike attacks. Señor Croma can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Radiant Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

Professors of radiance call up magic through spoken words and glyphs formed of magically shaped ink and light. The professors channel radiance to illuminate their allies, bolstering them with encouragement and inspiring any who witness their orations. Professors of radiance can turn their words into potent assets in battle or strike at their foes with searing radiance.
These Silverquill teachers seek to inspire greatness in all that they do, pushing their students to look for the good in all things and bring that into the light.

entries.name: Silverquill Scholars
entries: The scholars of Silverquill College study the power of magic shaped through spoken and written words. They use that power either to illuminate and guide or to obscure and demoralize.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Señor croma has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Señor croma to sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azul casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Azul makes two attacks using Longsword, Bewitching Bolt, or a combination of them.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Bewitching Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition charmed} condition until the start of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Duplicitous Movement (1/Day)
entries: Azul projects an illusory duplicate of herself in an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of herself. Azul can then swap places with the illusion. The illusion vanishes after 1 minute, if Azul is {@condition incapacitated}, or if the illusion is more than 120 feet from Azul.
As a bonus action on later turns, Azul can move the illusion up to 30 feet and can then swap places with it.
Firbolgs inspired by the saga of Diancastra embark on adventures to create their own legends. These wanderers use their magic for trickery and disguise to emulate Diancastra.

entries.name: Firbolgs
entries: Distant cousins of giants, the first firbolgs wandered the primeval forests of the multiverse, and the magic of those forests entwined itself with the firbolgs' souls. Ages later, that magic still thrums inside firbolgs.

Firbolgs are often drawn to the service or emulation of the gods Diancastra and Hiatea. Firbolgs' innate magic of obscurement and trickery resonates with Diancastra's wily resourcefulness. A traditional emphasis on community and harmony leads many firbolgs to pledge themselves to Hiatea's service.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Naranja casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Naranja makes two Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) psychic damage.

bonus.name: Displacement {@recharge 5}
entries: Naranja projects an illusion that makes Naranja appear to be standing in a place a few inches from his actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against Naranja. The effect lasts for 1 minute, and it ends early if Naranja takes damage, if he is {@condition incapacitated}, or if his speed becomes 0.
Illusionists twist light, sound, and even thought to create illusory effects. Some illusionists are delightful entertainers, while others are devilish tricksters.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the bodyguard can regain 9 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bodyguard makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the bodyguard can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the bodyguard, the bodyguard can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

spell.name: Circe's Blood Searching
entries: You gain insight into the physical attributes of a creature given that you posses one of the necessary components. When you cast this spell, basic information about the target's basic apearance, race, height, weight and age will be revealed to you as a vision.

m.text: body part, a piece of nail, a lock or piece of hair, drop of blood, tear, sweat stained clothing item from the target, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Circe's Soul Searching
entries: You have learned about the connection that personal belongings hold with a creature's spirit, by casting this spell while holding the material component you will gain insight into the target's name, personality and aligment.

When you finish the ritual you learn the previous information and then you can use your action to attempt to gain more knowledge about the target. The target must make a Charisma saving throw, on a failure the spell ends, on a success you must choose two pieces of information out of the following areas:

items: the target's hopes/fears
the target's worries/insecurities
happiest or saddest memory from the target
the name of the creature the target holds most dear
the name of the creature the target hates

entries: By casting this spell on the material component, fiery runes will appear on its surface, burning it slowly until nothing is left but it's ashes. This spell fails immediately if the target is dead, undead, a construct or doesn't have a soul.

m.text: something that belongs to the target, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Circe's Last Words
entries: You can tap into the connection between a creatures body and the remaining fragments of their soul, still binded within.

Remove one eye and one ear from the creature's corpse and place them inside the water container, together with the herbal powders. When casting this spell, fiery runes will appear around and above the surfice of the water and container, turning the water into a misty vortex filled with light and dark areas. When you dip your head into the container, you can hear and see the last moments of a creature's life as if it were through your own eyes and ears.
You will not be able to see anything if the target was blind or had been {@condition blinded}, or hear anything if the target was deaf or had been {@condition deafened}.
This spell takes no effect is the target is undead or a construct, or has no soul.
It is for the DM to determine how long your vision lasts and exactly what you see and hear.

m.text: the target's eye, the target's ear, a continer filled with water that can fit your head, rare herbal powders worth at least 100 gp

spell.name: Circe's Cat Got Your Tongue
entries: By placing the tongue of a creature inside another willing creature's mouth, the target adquires this creature's tone of voice, accent, pronuntiation, cadence and language. For the duration of this spell, you can only speak in the target's known languages and their tone of voice. You also gain any singing profeciencies that the target might have, but, if any, magical effects on the tongue that had been there beforehand dissappear. When the spell ends you can use an action to cast it again, spending a spellslot as usual.
This spell does not work on mutes, or constructs.

spell.name: Circe's Delight of the Barren
entries: This spell curses a creature on the same plane of existence as you with utter infertility. The target must make a Charisma saving throw against the spell's DC, which is modified by the {@table Curse Strength Table|GH}. On a successful save, the target becomes aware that somebody attempted to curse them. On a failed save, the target becomes cursed and is unaware of this. Upon the completion of this curse's triggering event, the target automatically advances to stage 1 of this curse.
{@b Triggering event.} The next time the cursed creature goes to sleep, they will have an extremely realistic nightmare of everyone they hold dear leaving them.
{@b Stage 1.} The cursed creature suffers from a stomach ache that will go away and come back arbitrarily. By this stage, the creature is already barren.

{@b Stage 2.} The cursed creature finds themselves to appear uglier every time they look at themselves in a mirror. Their hair turning gray, their skin wrinkly and their teeth yellow. Additionally, the cursed creature has disadvantage on charisma saving throws.

{@b Stage 3.} The cursed creature will find themselves seeking the company and aid of others to the point of madness, but something will make the people around them reject them, as if they were disgusting and unlovable. Additionally, the creature's charisma score becomes 6.

{@b Culmination.} Upon failing the final escalation check, the cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a {@creature The Lonely|MTF}. If the creature is a player character, they become an NPC under the GM's control.

m.text: a piece of the target's hair, a wooden doll resembling the target and a Shadowsteel hand mirror worth at least 1,000 gp, all of which the spell consumes

legendaryGroup.name: Shegovax
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Shegovax can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; Shegovax  can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Hellish atmosphere
entries: Shegovax's lair becomes extremely hot. All creatures within the lair must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Glyphs of Restrain
entries: A 30-foot-square area of ground within 120 feet of Shegovax illuminates with glyphs and arcane symbols until initiative count 20 on the next round. Any creature that starts or ends its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by arcane chains. A creature can escape the chains with a successful {@dc 22} Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action. This effect lasts for 1 minute unless dispelled (it counts as a 6th level spell)

items.name: Glyphs of Darkness
entries: Shegovax casts the {@spell darkness} spell four times, targeting different areas with the spell. Shegovax doesn't need to concentrate on the spells, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round.

regionalEffects: The region containing Shegovax's lair is warped by his magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items.name: Carrier of Death
entries: The area within 9 miles of the lair is filled with the stench of burning meat and rotting flesh.

items.name: Hellish Engines
entries: Flaming winds scour the area within 2 miles of Shegovax's lair. Any creature without resistance to fire damage suffers 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} for every hour spent this close to the lair. And all creatures within the lair must make a Constitution saving throw as mentioned in the Extreme Heat rules starting with a {@dc 10}.

items.name: Black Smoke
entries: The area within 2 miles outside of the lair, is filled with black smoke, which causes the area to be heavily obscured. The smoke can't be cleared away.

regionalEffects: If Shegovax dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: The Emperor
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Emperor can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; The Emperor  can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Scarlet Flood
entries: The Emperor controls the spilled blood of its family, covering the floor with a sleek layer of blood, turning it into magical difficult terrain until initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Bond of Strength
entries: The ancestral lair itself enhances the family's powers. All creatures in the Emperor's bloodline, including the Emperor itself, gain +1 to their attacks and saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Family Reunion
entries: The members of the Emperor's bloodline are rallied to defend their leader. All creatures in the Emperor's bloodline, including the Emperor itself, can move up to their speed immediately without incurring attacks of opportunity.

items.name: Royal Sorcery
entries: The raw sorcerous magic of the Emperor's bloodline has seeped into the walls and floors of the lair, allowing the Hierarch to manipulate all spells cast within. The Emperor can apply one of its uses of metamagic to any spell cast within the lair without expending any of the Emperor's limited uses of metamagic until initiative count 20 on the next round.
